Installation¶

How to install robusta?¶

Currently robusta is expected to work only on linux (not tested on MacOSX), given the difficulties in installing 3.x versions of rpy2 on Windows (see here).

How to install

1. Make sure R R >=3.5 is installed (e.g. run $ R -e "version" | grep "version.string" in your shell).

2. $ pip install robusta-stats. Since on Linux R libraries are usually built from source, installation could take a while on the first time you run it (unless your R installation already includes some of the dependencies).
